content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
RISK-ON: low volatility (Vol: 18.1%) and broad participation (Breadth: 6/8 sectors positive), supporting risk-taking and cyclicals. Market tone is bullish with strong momentum across banks, holdings and retail.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Banking & Finance leading: AKBNK (1W: +14.19% | 1M: +23.74%) ABOVE TREND; ISCTR (1W: +10.14% | 1M: +17.11%) ABOVE TREND; GARAN (1W: +6.17% | 1M: +6.95%) ABOVE TREND. Holding & Investment also strong: SAHOL (1W: +9.63% | 1M: +23.09%) ABOVE TREND and KCHOL (1W: +2.92% | 1M: +17.11%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Energy & Chemicals soft overall: PETKM (1W: -2.09% | 1M: +7.48%) CORRECTION; TRALT (1W: -8.72% | 1M: +17.25%) CORRECTION. Technology & Telecom showing short-term pullback: TCELL (1W: -1.13% | 1M: +18.23%) CORRECTION; TTKOM (1W: -0.68% | 1M: +12.48%) CORRECTION.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
AKBNK (1W: +14.19% | 1M: +23.74%) ABOVE TREND; ENKAI (1W: +12.31% | 1M: +19.08%) ABOVE TREND; SISE (1W: +10.85% | 1M: +15.89%) ABOVE TREND; ISCTR (1W: +10.14% | 1M: +17.11%) ABOVE TREND; SAHOL (1W: +9.63% | 1M: +23.09%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
TRALT (1W: -8.72% | 1M: +17.25%) CORRECTION; ASELS (1W: -7.35% | 1M: +30.10%) CORRECTION; HALKB (1W: -7.10% | 1M: +12.71%) CORRECTION; TRMET (1W: -6.51% | 1M: +22.31%) CORRECTION; ALARK (1W: -4.29% | 1M: -0.47%) BELOW TREND.

6. Momentum Stocks?
Up-momentum: AKBNK (1W: +14.19% | 1M: +23.74%) ABOVE TREND; ENKAI (1W: +12.31% | 1M: +19.08%) ABOVE TREND; SISE (1W: +10.85% | 1M: +15.89%) ABOVE TREND. Down-momentum (watch for mean reversion/risk): TRALT (1W: -8.72% | 1M: +17.25%) CORRECTION; ASELS (1W: -7.35% | 1M: +30.10%) CORRECTION; HALKB (1W: -7.10% | 1M: +12.71%) CORRECTION.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banking remains the market engine: AKBNK (1W: +14.19% | 1M: +23.74%) ABOVE TREND, ISCTR (1W: +10.14% | 1M: +17.11%) ABOVE TREND, GARAN (1W: +6.17% | 1M: +6.95%) ABOVE TREND. Caution around HALKB (1W: -7.10% | 1M: +12.71%) CORRECTION as volatility in individual names can spike.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Auto and steel mixed: FROTO (1W: +5.57% | 1M: +19.04%) ABOVE TREND and TOASO (1W: +5.42% | 1M: +23.96%) ABOVE TREND leading, while EREGL (1W: -0.22% | 1M: +13.71%) CORRECTION and ASELS (1W: -7.35% | 1M: +30.10%) CORRECTION show short-term profit-taking.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy scoreboard mixed: TUPRS (1W: +1.15% | 1M: +22.78%) ABOVE TREND and SISE (1W: +10.85% | 1M: +15.89%) ABOVE TREND outperform, while PETKM (1W: -2.09% | 1M: +7.48%) CORRECTION, OYAKC (1W: -2.64% | 1M: +13.00%) CORRECTION and TRALT (1W: -8.72% | 1M: +17.25%) CORRECTION lag.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Stay overweight cyclicals and banks while trimming isolated, structurally weaker tech names; prioritize high-quant retail and construction names. Use profits to add selectively to beaten-up quality names with strong 1M momentum (e.g., AKBNK, SAHOL) and keep cash for short-term pullbacks.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
AKBNK (1W: +14.19% | 1M: +23.74%) ABOVE TREND for follow-through; ENKAI (1W: +12.31% | 1M: +19.08%) ABOVE TREND for construction strength; SISE (1W: +10.85% | 1M: +15.89%) ABOVE TREND for reflation trade; ASELS (1W: -7.35% | 1M: +30.10%) CORRECTION as a volatility play.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Banking & Finance for leadership continuation and rate-sensitivity; Retail & Food for resilient consumer demand and strong quant scores. Monitor Energy & Chemicals for commodity-driven reversals.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Watch XU100 reaction at recent breakout and maintain stops on positions if market gives a 3-5% reversal; follow headline catalysts: Turkish CPI prints, CBRT signals, and company earnings/updates from banks and large holdings. Positive macro prints and stable FX should extend the current RISK-ON move; disappointing data will rapidly widen intra-week dispersion.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Low-volatility RISK-ON market with 6/8 sectors positive; banks, holdings and retail are leading while energy and telecom show short-term weakness. Tactical bias: overweight cyclicals and high-quant retail/construction names, trim short-term laggards and size positions for potential mean-reversion in the most volatile names.
